titles.title: Congratulating Fort Detrick on 60 years of service to the United States.
Congratulating Fort Detrick, Maryland, on 60 years of service to the Nation.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Mr. Bartlett (MD) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 271.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 10/1/2003--Passed House amended. Recognizes the 60 years of service of Fort Detrick, Maryland, to the Nation. Commends Army military and civilian personnel, other elements of the Department of Defense, and other Federal departments and agencies who have worked at Fort Detrick to: (1) defend the United States against biological and chemical attack; and (2) develop vaccines for all types of illnesses.
